about: Every turtle bottles community care, geolocates along humanitarian drift corridors, and feeds open dashboards that coordinate relief without borders.
about_paragraph1: The Hope Turtle Project is a decentralized, ecological and open-source solution to getting hope across seas to humans who need it.
about_paragraph2: Guided by open-source, earthen and subaltern principles, the hopeTurtles project combines low-tech and high-tech ingenuity with high-impact humanitarian logistics. The project centers on small, autonomous marine drones—nicknamed Hope Turtles—engineered to carry aid payloads and building materials across bodies of water using readily available materials (i.e. recovered bottles), open-source hardware (i.e. raspberry pis) and inexpensive organic materials (i.e. bamboo).
about_paragraph3: Guided by these principles, a hope turtle can be inexpensively made and assembled collaboratively just about anywhere. Folks with electronics skills can assemble the opensource hardware. Meanwhile, anyone anywhere keen to make a real, physical contribution to a humanitarian crisis can contribute the food-filled aid bottles that the hopeTurtle will be assembled with. By cutting through the politics or borders and blockades, it enables humans to connect directly to other humans with a real-life gift.
about_paragraph4: Each Turtle is designed to operate independently or in coordinated flotillas, guided by GPS and onboard microcontrollers that log their journey and transmit telemetry data back to a shared, transparent database. By studying ocean currents, the right release points for hope turtles can be discerned and individuals, communities and flotillas can release them accordingly.
about_paragraph5: At its heart, the project aims to demonstrate how community-built, ecologically principled technology can bridge distances and deliver hope across seas—without fossil fuels, military infrastructure, or centralized control. By inviting local makers, engineers, and communities to replicate, adapt, and deploy their own Hope Turtles, the movement fosters decentralized collaboration and resilience. It’s not just about robotics or transport—it’s a living experiment in applying collective compassion, ecological ethics, open-source design to global challenges.
contribute_bottle_body: Send in food filled aid bottles to our coordination hubs
contribute_build_body: Assemble the hardware for a Hope Turtle
contribute_buy_body: Purchase food orders for our hubs to fill aid bottles
contribute_code_body: Help develop our turtle python code on Github
contribute_commission_body: Commission the deployment of a HopeTurtle and become its captain
contribute_deploy_body: Help deploy a hub or boat that can receive and release Hope Turtles
contribute_subtitle: The HopeTurtle project is 100% open source and collaboration powered!  You can get involved in a bunch of ways.
dashboard_intro: Your mission control for launching and managing aid bottle and hope turtles on human to human missions.
footer_contact_blurb: A last mile, ecological, decentralized and open source pathway to connect humans to humans in moments of need.
footer_regen_blurb: Hosted in Indonesia, by Dewaweb with custom in site carbon accounting..
hero_blurb: Autonomous floating companions riding ocean currents to deliver regenerative aid and track our shared impact.
hero_image_alt: Illustration of a Hope Turtle floating in the ocean
landing_intro_paragraph1: The Hope Turtle Project is a decentralized, ecological and open-source solution to getting hope across seas to humans who need it.
landing_intro_paragraph2: Guided by open-source, earthen and subaltern principles, the hopeTurtles project enables anyone anywhere to contribute to collective aid delivery to by-pass borders and blockades using ocean winds and currents. The project centers on small, autonomous marine drones—nicknamed Hope Turtles—engineered to deliver aid-filled bottles using bottles and bamboo, open-source hardware and software powered fully by the love, care and compassion.
landing_welcome_title: Welcome to the Hope Turtle Project!
login_intro: Authenticate with Buwana SSO to manage Hope Turtles.
login_redirect: When you continue you will be redirected to the Buwana login page.
mission: Hope Turtles are solar-assisted, bamboo-bodied drift craft that ferry regenerative aid across currents while broadcasting transparent telemetry to coastal stewards.

team_intro: These are the stewards, technologists, and storytellers who have declared their roles inside the platform. Every card below reflects a user with a team_title in their Hope Turtle profile.
